results.byline: By J. David Goodman, Edgar Sandoval, Karen Zraick and Rick Rojas
results.title: Children called for help from inside classrooms in Uvalde. The police waited.
results.abstract: A new timeline from the state police raised questions about whether lives could have been saved with swift action.

media.caption: Law enforcement officials outside Robb Elementary School on Tuesday.

results.title: Tropical Storm Agatha Headed to the Mexican Coast
results.abstract: This year’s first named storm in the eastern Pacific has the potential to become a Category 2 hurricane, forecasters said on Saturday.

media.caption: Tropical Storm Agatha moving slowly off southern Mexico on Saturday. It could make landfall as a Category 2 hurricane on Monday, forecasters said.

results.byline: By Mike Ives and Johnny Diaz
results.title: Five Killed as House Explodes in Pennsylvania
results.abstract: Two others were hospitalized in Pottstown on Friday, officials said. The cause of the explosion was not immediately known.

media.caption: The scene of an explosion in Pottstown, Pa., on Thursday. Officials reported that five people were killed.

results.abstract: A new poem from Amanda Gorman, written after the tragedy in Uvalde, Texas.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus Risks and Safety Concerns;Travel and Vacations;Airlines and Airplanes;Quarantine (Life and Culture);American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene;Canada Border Services Agency;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.title: Testing Positive and Using the ‘Backdoor’ to Get Into the U.S.
results.abstract: Entering the United States by air requires a negative coronavirus test. Some people who can’t provide one are using a workaround: flying to Canada or Mexico, then entering via a land border.
org_facet: American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Crossings at land borders, like this one at the Peace Bridge connecting Canada and the United States, do not require negative coronavirus tests.

results.byline: By Ben Protess, William K. Rashbaum and Jonah E. Bromwich
results.title: Trump’s Federal Suit Against New York A.G. Is Dismissed
results.abstract: Mr. Trump had argued that an inquiry by the attorney general, Letitia James, violated his constitutional rights. It was his second legal loss in two days.

media.caption: The ruling clears the way for Letitia James, the New York attorney general, to complete her civil investigation into Donald J. Trump in the coming weeks or months.
media.copyright: Veasey Conway for The New York Times

results.title: The Good News in Georgia That’s Bad News for Trump
results.abstract: Republicans in key swing-state offices can know that they have a future in the party if, in the event of a contested election, they simply do their job.

media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.byline: By Glenn Thrush and Sarah Mervosh
results.title: Three headliners pulled out of this week’s N.R.A. convention, citing Uvalde.
results.abstract: Don McLean and Larry Gatlin withdrew out of respect to the victims, as teachers’ unions joined protests for gun control planned in Houston.

media.caption: Singer Don McLean performing at The Canyon Club in Agoura Hills, Calif., in 2017.

results.adx_keywords: Reality Television;Home Repairs and Improvements;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Suits and Litigation (Civil);HGTV
results.title: What Goes On Behind the Cameras at Home Makeover Shows?
results.abstract: Some homeowners said they were promised a dream house if a crew remade their homes for TV. The lawsuits they filed later told a different story.

media.caption: Paul and Mindy King went on Property Brothers in 2019. They are now suing Cineflix, the production company behind the program, saying that what they got was a house riddled with structural and electrical issues, some of which, they contend, are producing serious health concerns for Ms. King.
media.copyright: Bridget Bennett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Personal Profile;Archives and Records;Archaeology and Anthropology;Holocaust and the Nazi Era;World War II (1939-45);Books and Literature;Kertzer, David I;Pius XII;Hitler, Adolf;Mussolini, Benito;Roman Catholic Church;Italy
results.title: Deep in Vatican Archives, Scholar Discovers ‘Flabbergasting’ Secrets
results.abstract: David Kertzer has spent decades excavating the Vatican’s hidden history, with his work winning a Pulitzer and capturing Hollywood’s attention. A new book examines Pope Pius XII’s role in the Holocaust.

media.caption: David Kertzer at the library of the American Academy in Rome, after a day of scholarly investigations inside the Vatican’s archives.
media.copyright: Massimo Berruti for The New York Times

results.title: Students in the room with the gunman called 911 many times.
results.abstract: Students who were in the classroom with the gunman called 911 several times, including a lengthy call during which some shooting and other sounds of the attack could be heard, according to Steven McCraw, director of the Texas Department of Public Safety.

results.abstract: One dismisses any talk about new gun safety measures and the other pledges to find a compromise with Democrats on new gun laws.

media.caption: Senator Ted Cruz in Ulvade, Texas, on Wednesday.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;United States National Anthem Protests (2016- );Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Kapler, Gabe;Kaepernick, Colin;San Francisco Giants
results.title: Amid Gun Violence, Giants Manager Will Not Come Out for Anthem
results.abstract: San Francisco’s Gabe Kapler says he will not take the field during the national anthem “until I feel better about the direction of our country.”

media.caption: Gabe Kapler has been the manager of the San Francisco Giants for three seasons. Last year he led the team to a major league-best 107 wins.

results.title: Cockroach Reproduction Has Taken a Strange Turn
results.abstract: In response to pesticides, many cockroach females have lost their taste for sweet stuff, which changes how they make the next generation of insects.

media.caption: A male cockroach, right, attracting a female cockroach with a fat-and-sugar mix extruded from the tergal gland. Some female cockroaches are becoming immune to this practice.

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Buffalo, NY, Shooting (May 14, 2022);Gun Control;Basketball;Baseball;Kerr, Steve;Golden State Warriors;New York Yankees;Tampa Bay Rays
results.title: The Week When Sports Would Not Let America Look Away
results.abstract: As their games continued in the wake of mass shootings in Buffalo and Uvalde, Texas, Golden State Coach Steve Kerr, the Yankees and the Tampa Bay Rays made powerful statements against gun violence.

media.caption: In a news conference on Tuesday, Steve Kerr, Golden State’s head coach, waved off basketball questions to plead for gun control legislation. “When are we going to do something?” he asked.
media.copyright: Scott Strazzante/San Francisco Chronicle, via Associated Press

results.title: Up to 50 Subpoenas Expected as Grand Jury Begins Trump Inquiry
results.abstract: The district attorney in Fulton County, Ga., is weighing racketeering charges connected to G.O.P. attempts to overturn the 2020 election.

media.caption: Fani Willis, the Fulton County district attorney, has said that Mr. Trump created a threatening atmosphere with his open criticism of the investigation.

results.byline: By Michael Barbaro, Stella Tan, Rob Szypko, Rikki Novetsky, Eric Krupke, Patricia Willens, Lisa Chow, Mike Benoist, Marion Lozano, Dan Powell and Chris Wood
results.title: What Really Caused the Baby Formula Shortage
results.abstract: The recent shutdown of one of the largest production plants in the United States has sent families scrambling to find essential food for their children.
